text: Dash in in field and working with a team
is is totally different than your
traditional academic experience it's
really about learning how you can work
with a really broad range of people to
come up with the best product we are
working uh with Whirlpool down in uh
Brazil in South Pao and we're working to
create an all-in-one inhome Drink
Machine our group of six split into
three teams of two and went to three
different areas around Boston to just
talk with people we started this
exercise having assumptions of what
customers needed in terms of Beverage we
went out there talk to people and we
noticed slowly that people are not so
predictable and there are some uh
variability in terms of what they prefer
or their habits we are concepting a
brand new product for a consumer goods
company we each took a little bit of
time beforehand to kind of think of some
some ideas on our own but the thing
about field 2 is that diversity in
backgrounds brings diversity of ideas it
was crazy to see you know how many more
or different or better ideas we had as a
team versus what we had as an individual
I think working with a team is a lot of
fun it's also a big challenge you have a
lot of different perspectives when
looking at a problem so managing how we
all kind of see a problem and interact
with a problem was certainly a challenge
over the past couple days we've had a
very intensive process we only had 36
hours to come up with a new prototype
and model that we would would then
present and pitch um to our fellow
classmates we learned probably more in
those 36 hours than we could ever
reading a document in a case Fields I
think can really push us in a way that
our other classes push us to think and
to understand and field pushes us to do
this is great preparation for when we
actually go on our trip to India what
this helped us do was kind of figure out
both the product development process but
also figure out each other after that I
feel um more prepared and I think it was
very good for us to start working on
this product even if it's for the US
customer cuz gave us a lot of ideas and
tips for approaching uh clients and
approaching the process in itself can't
wait to be in Brazil
